The '''Citadel of Minas Tirith''',<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry for ''Tower of Ecthelion'', p. 514</ref><ref name=UIHighCourt>{{HM|UI}}, entry for ''High Court'', p. 515</ref><ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry for ''White Tower'', p. 361</ref> '''Citadel'''<ref name=MT>{{RK|MT}}</ref>{{rp|752}} or '''High City'''<ref name=Steward>{{RK|Steward}}</ref>{{rp|972}} was the topmost seventh walled circle of the city of [[Minas Tirith]].<ref name=UIHighCourt/><ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry for ''High City'', p. 638</ref>

== Description ==
The Citadel was a strong fortress<ref name=MT/>{{rp|761}} on the top of the [[Hill of Guard]], on which the city of Minas Tirith was built,<ref>{{HM|N}}, entry for ''Hill of Guard'', p. 772</ref> 700 feet above the [[Great Gate of Minas Tirith]].<ref name=MT/>{{rp|752}} It consisted of the topmost seventh wall in the shape of a circle with seven towers at equal distances along the wall, of which one tower stood next to the gate of the Citadel. On its eastern side was a battlement on the top of a pier of rock, which looked like a ship-keel and rose from the ground behind the Great Gate on the lowest circle of walls of the city.<ref name=Plan>{{SD|Partings}}, p. 67 citing from a plan of the Citadel that was drawn by J.R.R. Tolkien on a manuscript</ref>     

The entrance to the Citadel was on the east side and was carved into the rock. A sloping lamp-lit tunnel led up to the seventh gate, which was guarded by the [[Guards of the Citadel]].<ref name=MT/>{{rp|752–3}}

The [[Tower of Ecthelion]]<ref name=MT/>{{rp|751}} and the [[Hall of the Kings]]<ref name=Steward/>{{rp|968}} were in the centre of the Citadel.<ref name=Plan/> In front of (i.e. east of) the Tower of Ecthelion was<ref name=Plan/> the [[Court of the Fountain (Minas Tirith)|Court of the Fountain]] where the [[White Tree of Gondor|White Tree]] had grown and died<ref name=MT/>{{rp|753}} and grew again after King [[Aragorn]] had found and planted a seedling of it.<ref name=Steward/>{{rp|971}} Behind (i.e. west of) the Tower of Ecthelion stood<ref name=Plan/> the [[King's House]].<ref>{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 1640, p. 1086</ref> To the right of (i.e. north of) the Tower of Ecthelion was<ref name=Plan/> the [[Great Hall of Feasts]].<ref name=Partings>{{RK|Partings}}, p. 975</ref> The Citadel also contained barracks for the Guard, a storehouse and buttery for the Guard,<ref name=MT/>{{rp|762}} a mess for the Guard in a small hall on the north side,<ref name=MT/>{{rp|772}} a house for guests close to the walls on the north side,<ref name=MT/>{{rp|759}} armories<ref>{{RK|Siege}}, p. 807</ref> and deep vaults.<ref>{{RK|Siege}}, p. 814</ref>

It is possible that [[Éomer]], the new [[King of Rohan]], referred to the city of Minas Tirith in general and not to the Citadel of Minas Tirith as the topmost seventh circle of the city, when he said that the dead [[Théoden]], his uncle and former King of Rohan, lay in the "Citadel of Gondor".<ref>{{RK|Houses}}, p. 868</ref><ref group=note>The only instance, where the term Citadel of Gondor is used is in the statement made by Éomer who is not from the city of Minas Tirith. [[Wayne G. Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull]] use the term Citadel of Minas Tirith in their index in their book ''[[The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion]]''.</ref> At the time of his statement the body of Théoden had been laid on a bed of state in front of the dais in the Hall of the Kings<ref>{{RK|Houses}}, p. 861</ref> and was later laid in a tomb in the [[Hallows]] of Minas Tirith,<ref name=Steward/>{{rp|969}}<ref name=Partings/> which were located behind (i.e. west of) the fifth circle of the city.<ref name=MT/>{{rp|752}}

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
In a preliminary draft of what would later become the chapter "[[The Steward and the King]]" it is mentioned that the house in which the Companions of the Ring lived together with Gandalf was in the citadel.<ref>{{SD|King}}, p. 57</ref> In an earlier version of what would later become the chapter "[[Many Partings]]", Merethrond is said to be in the citadel. A page for this passage contains a plan of the citadel, which shows the shape of the wall, the locations of the towers, of the White Tower and the Hall of the Kings, of the Court of the Fountain, of the King's House and of the Hall of Feasts and outlines of other buildings.<ref>{{SD|Partings}}, p. 67</ref>
